metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1564 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 32.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.1, and Thunderbird31.x before 31.1 do not properly initialize memory for GIF rendering, whichallows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memoryvia crafted web script that interacts with a CANVAS element associated witha malformed GIF image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
